paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Lampyris vittata G. A. Olivier 1790: 23
[original combination]

Bicellonycha vittata (G. A. Olivier)
[new combination by
Motschulsky 1854d: 59
]

Photinus vittatus (G. A. Olivier)
[new combination by
Gorham 1898: 320
]

Pygolampis vittatus (G. A. Olivier)
[new combination by E.
Olivier 1912b: 27
]

Photinus vittatus (G. A. Olivier)
[reinstated combination by
Leng & Mutchler 1922: 478
]

Diphotus vittatus (G. A. Olivier)
[new combination by
McDermott 1955: 50
]

Robopus vittatus (G. A. Olivier)
[new combination by
McDermott 1964: 7
]

Heterophotinus vittatus (G. A. Olivier)
[new combination by
Kazantsev 2007: 367
]

subSubSection.paragraph: DISTRIBUTION: DOMINICAN REPUBLIC : Azua , Baoruco , Barahona , Dajabón , Distrito Nacional , Duarte , Elías Piña , Espaillat , Hato Mayor , Hermanas Mirabal , Independencia , La Vega , Monseñor Nouel , Monte Cristi , Monte Plata , Pedernales , Peravia , Puerto Plata , Samaná , San Cristóbal , San Juan, San Pedro de Macorís , Santiago , Santo Domingo ( Gorham 1898 ; Blackwelder 1945 ; Blackwelder & Arnett 1974 ; Kazantsev & Perez-Gelabert 2009 ; Perez-Gelabert 2011b ; Perez-Gelabert 2015 )

REMARKS:
Wolcott (1923
, 1936 , 1948 ) reported this species eaten by cliff swallows, warblers, petcharies, vireos, and parula warblers (Aves).
Wolcott (1923
, 1936 ) reported it from lights, sugar cane, coffee, and grapefruit.
Wolcott (1936
, 1948 ) additionally reported it eaten by
Anolis cristatelus
( Reptilia : Dactyloidae ).
Wolcott (1936)
reported it being also found on tomato, potato, cucumber, eggplant, papaya, and pepper. Meurgey & Ramage (2020) erroneously used
Robopus vittatus
.
